result.execSummary:
The defendant Adan M Alaniz III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations per DOC policy.

superMiscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after serving 65% of sentence.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 11:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adan M Alaniz III in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Adan M Alaniz III.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adan M Alaniz III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Adan M Alaniz III.   Officer Khang is sworn and questioned by Attorney McGrath. Testifies to arriving at the Rapids Inn for a scheduled buy.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to observing the defendants with backpacks on.  Testifies to the items found in the backpacks.  Testifies that due to the amount of drugs, it was determined that the drugs were for sale. Cross examination by Attorney Slattery.  Questions witness regarding what items were found in the bag belonged to defendant Alaniz.   Questions witness regarding the property found on defendant McGuffey.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jakobson.  Court takes judicial notice of Wood County Case No. 20CF76.

Attorney Slattery argues in opposition of bindover. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that  a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adan M Alaniz III appeared by video, in custody.  Bond continued.

No contact with co-defendant K.M.; Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription. 22-4686 $25,000
Defendant appeared by video from Wood County Jail.

No contact with co-defendant, Kaitlyn McGuffrey. Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
